tool.name: Tool3

param.name: feas
param.dialogReference: Input a polygon or point layer with fields such as feature ID and population.

param.name: disfile
param.dialogReference: Input distance file if the user defined distance.

param.name: deviation
param.dialogReference: Input the maximun deviation of the population in each district.

param.name: Penalty
param.dialogReference:
Input a penalty cost.

If the value of deviation is small, the capacity constrains will not be satisfied. The penalty cost is used to decrease the gaps between district population and capacity limits.

Usually, set a large penalty cost (e.g. 1000) for large deviation (e.g. 0.05), or set a small penalty cost (e.g. 1.0) for small deviation (e.g. 0.0, 0.01).

param.name: Solver
param.dialogReference:
Select a sovler.

Note that CPLEX or other MIP Optimizer muat be installed if select the mip solver.

param.name: timelimit
param.dialogReference: input a time limit in second for problem sovling.

param.name: spp
param.dialogReference: Input 1 or 0 for using a additional SPP procedure or not.

param.name: mipSolver
param.dialogReference: Select a MIP solver if multiple MIP solvers are available.

param.name: operators
param.dialogReference:
Select local search operators.

Note that 'two-unit move' and 'three-unit move' are expensive in computation.

tool.summary:
The tool is used to solve political districting problem (PDP) or similar problems.

The PDP is defined as a special case of facility location problem: search district centers with constraints of "facility capacity" and district contiguity. Given the number of districts, the facility capacity is set as the average district population with a small deviation. The district compactness is ensured by total traveling distance. For details, please refer to Yunfeng Kong, Yanfang Zhu & Yujing Wang (2019) A center-based modeling approach to solve the districting problem, International Journal of Geographical Information Science, 33:2, 368-384, DOI: 10.1080/13658816.2018.1474472

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The tool is used to solve political districting problem (PDP) or similar problems.

The PDP is defined as a special case of facility location problem: search district centers with constraints of "facility capacity" and district contiguity. Given the number of districts, the facility capacity is set as the average district population with a small deviation. The district compactness is ensured by total traveling distance. For details, please refer to Yunfeng Kong, Yanfang Zhu & Yujing Wang (2019) A center-based modeling approach to solve the districting problem, International Journal of Geographical Information Science, 33:2, 368-384, DOI: 10.1080/13658816.2018.1474472
